parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to an official campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post uses hashtags #echipapentruilfovdeputați, #AlegeVoceaRațiunii, #GyőzzönAJózanÉsz, and #UDMR.  #UDMR clearly refers to the Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România (UDMR) party. The other hashtags suggest a campaign focused on Ilfov County deputies and promoting a "voice of reason," likely associated with the UDMR's platform. This directly identifies a parliamentary candidate (the UDMR party) and thus satisfies Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its reach beyond personal communication, satisfying Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The hashtags and the overall message strongly suggest an electoral objective. The phrases "echipa pentru ilfov deputați" (team for Ilfov deputies) and "Alege Vocea Rațiunii" (Choose the Voice of Reason) are clearly intended to persuade voters to support the UDMR candidates in the Ilfov County parliamentary elections. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content is not journalistic in nature. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific political party and its candidates.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; it's a clear campaign advertisement.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2968688483294798</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by RMDSZ/UDMR, promotes the party and its candidates for the Ilfov County parliamentary elections.  The hashtags directly reference the UDMR and advocate for their election. The post's paid nature and targeting ensure wide dissemination, clearly aiming to influence voters. While lacking a CMF number, the direct reference to the UDMR and its electoral campaign makes it a form of electoral propaganda.  The post's content and targeting strongly suggest an intention to influence the vote in favor of the UDMR.  The absence of a CMF number is mitigated by the clear and direct promotion of the UDMR party and its candidates.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România (UDMR)</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ/UDMR, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 2968688483294798), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu hashtag-uri precum #UDMR, #echipapentruilfovdeputați și #AlegeVoceaRațiunii, care promovează direct candidatul UDMR la alegerile parlamentare din Ilfov, având un efect electoral pozitiv pentru UDMR.  Reclama, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON, a atins peste 1 milion de oameni, conform datelor din Ad Library, și utilizează un video pentru a-și transmite mesajul.  Contactul advertiserului este demeterandras@rmdsz.ro și +40745600964.  Această reclamă constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie, conform articolului 98 t), întrucât are ca scop influențarea votului în favoarea UDMR.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
